TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy, mixed, superactive Ustic Haplocryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Sula - silt loam.
0 to 9 inches; dark grayish-brown (See Note 1) (10YR 3/2 moist) silt loam; soft granular or crumb structure; slightly acid. (7 to 12 inches thick)
9 to 12 inches; brown (7.5YR 5/4 moist) heavy silt loam; medium blocky structure; slightly acid. (3 to 6 inches thick)
12 to 22 inches; yellowish-brown (10YR 5/4 moist) heavy silt loam; moderately well developed irregular blocky structure; neutral or slightly acid.  (8 to 14 inches thick)
22 to 40 inches; brownish-yellow (10YR 6/6 moist) silt loam or very fine sandy loam; massive or ill-defined irregular blocky structure; about neutral. (16 to 24 inches thick)
40 inches; brown (7.5YR 5/4 moist) gritty clay loam; massive; about neutral. (1 to 5 feet thick)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content: RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  These soils are rather uniform throughout most of their distribution.  Where the parent materials are thickest the soils may grade into a substratum of fine sandy loam.  On some of the nearly flat areas the upper part of the subsoil is moderately heavy and tends toward Solonetz development.  In places, these soils are in complex association with thinly developed Solonetz.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Undulating and gently sloping bench remnants of old alluvia fans, terraces or valley-fill deposits.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  The soils are well drained; surface run-off is medium; permeability moderate.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Native bunch grasses and introduced species.  Pasture, dry-land and irrigation farming.

REMARKS.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REMARKS.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Bozeman, Montana
